event.name: FEDERATION_SUPPLY
event.text: You discover a fully militarized Federation station here, though it appears they are selling supplies to passing Federation allied ships.
No one is safe from you, not even allied Federation stations.
You aren't interested in the station. You ignore them.

event.name: FED_SUPPLY_STATION_KILL
event.text: Your unnecessary, unprovoked, barbaric attack on an allied Federation Station has been successful, if you could call killing them as success. You scrap what remains.

event.name: FEDERATION_FREECREW
event.text: A damaged Federation ship hails you. "Good, a friendly face for once. Our ship has taken catastrophic damage and there's no chance of repairing it. I don't suppose you'd be willing to allow me aboard? I'm a shield technician and I'm sure my skills could be of service to you."

choice.text: We don't need any more crew, sorry.

event.text: "Oh... ok. Hopefully I'll be able to keep the shields under control so they don't implode before another ship arrives to help..."
The Federation officer is thankful for your assistance.
As the human comes onto your ship, he draws a laser and shoots at you. Luckily, no one is hit, but a Rebel ship uncloaks nearby and attacks. It was a trap!

event.name: FEDERATION_RANT
event.text: Your arrival at this beacon is met with an unusual sight; an unarmed Illesctrian ship far from Zoltan territory. They contact you, and from their tone, the monk speaking to you does not seem particularly happy about something. "Renegade, this multiversal conflict is one of an endless cycle, one that you seem to be at the core of. But are you really fighting to try and end it, or just to perpetuate it further for your own gains?" Though Zoltans do not have faces, you nevertheless feel like they are staring intently at you, waiting to judge you for your answer.

choice.text: The Multiverse is full of conflict. Some fights must be finished to bring lasting peace.

event.text: The stare from the Zoltan monk softens slightly. "A wise answer. It is good to know that there is more to you Renegades than meets the eye. May your journey for peace bring good fortunes."

choice.text: The Multiverse is full of conflict. Some fights must be finished to bring lasting peace.

event.text: Despite your answer, the Zoltan still glares coldly at you. "A wise answer, is what I would have said if I was blind to your infamy. Your lies betray your true interests. Do not expect your deception to go without consequences!" Suddenly, as if in response to this, a Peacekeeper ship jumps in to confront you.

choice.text: We're just in it for the scrap and murder.

event.text: The Zoltan sighs. "It is because of people like you that this galaxy is stuck in perpetual turmoil! Though perhaps I might be able to communicate better using the barbaric language of your weaponry." They eject an unusual Bomb weapon from their ship towards yours. "May this inspire a change in your heart. Get out of my sight." They promptly jump away afterwards, leaving you to inspect their unexpected "gift" for you.
The Zoltan on the other end sighs deeply, before cutting comms and jumping away.

"Are you treating this like some idle matter? The decisions you make across your journey will each have consequences deep and long lasting! At least have the conviction in whatever they are, even if they are not necessarily as righteous as they should be." It seems your response has deeply angered them, and they intend to keep rambling on for a while longer.

choice.text: Let them continue, even if it takes a long time.

event.text: The Zoltan monk continues to rant on for a while longer. The meaning of their words soon vanishes from your mind, and eventually you lose track of how long has passed here. Just as you almost fall asleep from it, the monk asks you a simple question. "So, do you understand what I mean by this?"

"Ah, good to hear. Perhaps I misjudged you from the outset. Very well. I shall join your endeavors, to learn even more of your cause and your ways." Fortunately, they don't really seem to notice that you didn't pay any attention to what they said earlier.
"Seriously..." They almost begin another round of lecturing, but pass out from exhaustion just before they start again. You take this opportunity to leave them behind at this beacon.

"Ah, good to hear. Perhaps I misjudged you from the outset. Very well. I shall join your endeavors, to learn even more of your cause and your ways." Fortunately, they don't really seem to notice that you didn't pay any attention to what they said earlier.

You power up your weapons, intent on making them stop their ramblings. The Monks send out a distress signal, and soon enough a Zoltan ship answers it. The Monks jump away just before the fighting starts.

event.name: FEDERATION_AMMO
event.text: A Federation station is sending out a request for ammunition, in return for scrap. Their high demand is likely due to the increasing number of Rebel blockades. They might be able to spare some blueprints if you are generous.

choice.text: Offer 5 missiles for whatever scrap they have.
Offer 10 missiles for a patch-up and some extra fuel.
Offer 20 missiles out of the goodness of your heart.

event.text: "Wow, are you serious? Thank you, your kindness will not be forgotten! I'll make sure the Federation fleet understands what you've done for them."

choice.text: We don't have anything to sell.

event.text: You ignore the station.

event.name: FEDERATION_ITEM_DEBATE
event.text: An Engi ship, an Orchid ship, a Crystal ship and a Zoltan ship surround a debris field of multiple rebel ships. There was a large battle, but they were victorious.

choice.text: Ask if they need help salvaging the wreckage.

event.text:
At your prompting, the Orchid ship invites your ship to join their group communication. As soon as you do, the Crystal talks first.
"Hello, Renegade. There is a problem: The other ships are claiming that our crystal arsenal didn't sway the tide of our battle in our favor!"
The Orchid speaks up. "I'm sorry you had to get pulled into this Renegade. I do want to point out that our kernels penetrated the enemy shields and knocked out their engines. It's thanks to us that you had the accuracy you did."
The Zoltan snorts. "Baffling argument. Ludicrous, even. You may have scratched their paint job, but our Lucerne beam did the lion's share of the work. We did the most hull damage, therefore we were the most consequential ship in that fight. We don't even HAVE to aim."
The Engi ship chirps in. "Zoltan's assertion = illogical. Beams = inconsequential if (fire support == false). Engi combat drones >> all other contributions."

choice.text: The Engi is right. Drones probably had the biggest impact.

event.text: The Engi captain interjects. "Confirmed. Renegade has authenticated Engi logic. Therefore: Engi allocation of resources = most efficient." The other three captains sigh and nod. "Renegade: Delivering gratuity."

choice.text: The Zoltan is right. Beams ended the fight much quicker.

event.text: The Zoltan smirks. "It is plain to see. The Renegade's countless battles have exposed them to the truth. Therefore, I will distribute the spoils as I see fit. Any objections?" The other three captains are silent. "Wonderful. Oh, and here is a gift of appreciation, Renegade."

choice.text: The Orchid is right. Knocking out systems is vital to surviving fights.

event.text: The Orchid gesticulates in delight. "The Renegade is wise! With that in mind, you all can surely agree we get first dibs?" The Zoltan and Crystal mutter in annoyance, while the Engi simply nods. "Fantastic. Renegade, please accept a token of our thanks."

choice.text: The Crystal is right. Crystal weapons are a good balance between shield penetration and sustainability.

event.text: The Crystal proudly interjects. "As expected. Our weapons are superior, as is our decision making. We will be deciding who gets what." The others look annoyed but protest no longer. "Renegade, we will let you have this. You clearly know how to use it."

choice.text: (Drone, Crystal, Kernel, Beam) Behold, my loadout makes use of all of these!

event.text:
The others look on in wonder.
The Zoltan staggers backwards and clutches his chest. "Incredible. Our weapons are that synergistic?"
Orchid nods, pleased, "Of course! We are stronger together than we are apart. It makes sense!"
The Engi cocks its head to the side. "Compatibility = high. Renegade experience = greatest among us."
The Crystal nods. "I concur. Renegade, you may take the largest share, and we will evenly distribute the rest."

choice.text: Demand that they give you a portion of the scrap for your important mission.
(Upg. Cloaking) Attempt to steal some scrap when they are not looking.

event.text: With your cloaking device active, you carefully maneuver around the ship and try to get closer... but you don't have much time. You need a little extra reach to collect anything meaningful.

choice.text: No good. You don't have anything that can reach.

event.text: You carefully get out of there before you are noticed.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.
The other ships do not dignify your demands with a response.
The ships stop for a moment, and send you over a small tribute of materials. They seem too preoccupied to pay you any more attention.

event.name: FED_ARGEONN_CONTACT
event.text: A small Federation ship is skulking far from the beacon. They seem to be waiting for someone.
The Federation ship responds. "You're here for... business, aren't you?"
"Thought so. Let me tell them that the coast is clear." A moment later, an Argeonn ship approaches.

choice.text: Threaten to report the Federation ship for being in cahoots with smugglers.

event.text: The Federation captain quickly flies away. The smuggler angrily yells after the Federation captain: "Damn you! You were supposed to protect us!"
"I must have you confused for someone else. Go on your way."
You now have some time to do something on the ship.
The smuggler puts his hands up. "Okay, okay! Let's not get hasty! Surely a discerning Renegade like yourself would be amenable to an understanding. Perhaps you see something you like in my stock?"

choice.text: Take a free legal weapon off their hands.

event.text: "You have no eye for quality, Renegade. Even so, we appreciate your discretion."
"You're as shrewd as you are reasonable, Renegade. Pleasure doing business with you."
"Then you leave me no choice! Prepare to die!"
The smuggler screams, "Narcs get what they deserve! Prepare to die!" Meanwhile, the Federation ship makes a hasty retreat.
The Federation warms its weapons up. "You think you can just threaten my career and get away with it? I'll never give in!"
The smuggler is nowhere to be found. You radio the nearest Federation base and let them know that there is a smuggler on the loose.
You chase down the smuggler. "You law-abiding Federation types are scary! Please don't kill us!" You escort the smuggler to the nearest Federation base, where you are rewarded.
No Rebels will be allowed to live so long as you can help it.
You have no interest in fighting the Rebel ship.

textList.name: TEXT_FED_REBEL_CHOICE
textList.text: A Rebel ship is making minor repairs at this beacon, likely repairing the damage they took charging past the Federation's borders. They will probably leave you alone if you do not engage them.
A nearby Rebel gives you a wide berth. They're looking to damage Federation supply lines, not pick a fight with a Renegade.
Some Rebels break through the outer defenses of the sector. This one is avoiding you, likely not wanting to endanger its mission.
The Rebel fleet that is chasing you through this sector might not be focusing all their attention on you. This ship seems preoccupied.

event.name: FEDERATION_BROKEN_DRONE
event.text: A Federation automated supply drone nearby is on the fritz, sparking and occasionally sending garbled, meaningless messages. It must have received serious damage.
Your Engi is no stranger to working on Auto-ships and drones, and easily identifies the problem. Once the Auto-ship is fixed, it distributes supplies and patches up your hull.

Your Engineer tries to explain that they're only used to working on Rebel Auto-ships, but you convince them to try anyways. They manage to get the drone working long enough to repair some hull before something goes wrong and the ship turns hostile!
Your repair drone quickly patches up the Auto-ship. Once fixed, it distributes supplies and patches up your hull.

choice.text: (Lanius Crew) Have your Lanius salvage the drone.

event.text: Your Lanius is able to salvage the drone with little difficulty, knowing exactly what to disassemble to prevent triggering its defenses.
You aren't interested by the malfunctioning automaton.
You attempt to transmit your ID to the ship, in hopes it will still be able to distribute supplies. However, it seems to struggle identifying your ship, and suddenly attacks!
Luckily, though the drone is heavily damaged, it is still able to scan your Federation ID and transmit some supplies.
While salvaging the drone, it suddenly turns hostile and attacks!
The drone remains mostly unresponsive. Its weapons even come online, but it remains unable to fire.

event.name: FEDERATION_DRONE_TEST
event.text: A Federation research station is orbiting a nearby planet. You notice an unusually colored Federation auto-ship fly up from the planet and dock at the station, next to a few other similar vessels.

Your call is answered by an Engi wearing a lab coat. "Renegade, your arrival at Federation automated shipyard 78-A has been noted. We have a proposal for you. Our proposal: your assistance in testing novel auto-ship designs. Multiple testing applications are valid. Successful testing will be rewarded, and compensatory repairs will be supplied as well." They offer you multiple tests you can run on their auto-ships.

choice.text: Pick the "Drone Systems Targeting Analysis Test."

event.text: The Engi explains the test to you, and shows you the auto-ship you'll be running the test with. "Test requirements: allow automated ship to fire on your ship for duration of test. Damage to auto-ship hull = failure. System and ion damage are tolerable. Is this acceptable?"
The Engi powers up the auto-ship. It detaches from the station to face you.

choice.text: Pick the "Drone Hull Endurance Analysis Test."

event.text: The Engi explains the test to you, and shows you the auto-ship you'll be running the test with. "Test requirements: destroy automated ship. AI programming has already been saved elsewhere on this station, so destruction != a setback. Escape attempts will be registered as a test failure. Is this acceptable?"
The Engi powers up the auto-ship. It detaches from the station to face you.
Though the auto-ships are somewhat intriguing, you don't feel inclined to investigate further.

event.name: FED_DRONE_TEST_SUPERFAIL
event.text: "Test result = catastrophic failure. New recommendation to Renegade ship: piss off."

event.name: FED_DRONE_TEST_FAIL
event.text: "Test result = failure. As a result, consider all rewards and compensatory repairs to be annulled. Future recommendation: listen to provided instructions."

event.name: FED_DRONE_NODAMAGE_SUCCESS
event.text: The drone depowers after the testing session concludes. The Engi hails you. "Test results : Data successfully processed. Your performance = satisfactory. Reward will be provided momentarily." The station repairs your hull and rewards you as thanks for your contributions.

event.name: FED_DRONE_COMBAT_SUCCESS
event.text: The Engi hails you not long after the auto-ship explodes. "Test results : Data successfully processed. Your performance = satisfactory. Reward will be provided momentarily." The station repairs your hull and rewards you as thanks for your contributions.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: The testing session will end after this much time. Do not do any hull damage to the drone before then!

event.name: FEDERATION_HANGAR_RAID
event.text: A large Federation hangar has been built on the nearby planet. Any Federation ship is allowed to dock.
You transmit your ID and not long after are allowed to enter. A repair team moves in to refuel your ship and make some repairs.

As you exit the hangar a blaring siren fills the air. A Rebel squadron is approaching! The planetary defense cannons are overwhelmed and most of the Rebel ships are able to get past. An Elite ship locks onto you and attacks!
It's tempting, but you can't waste any time.

event.name: FEDERATION_SHIPCLASS
event.text: A nearby Federation ship is sending in a hail request.
A middle-aged human appears on your screen. "Greetings, Renegade cruis- erm, uh, vessel?"

"Well, even though cruiser would nowadays be the de-facto term to refer to a ship such as yours... my fascination in history just can't stomach the fact that naval terms have been dumbed down over the years. A cruiser required much more manpower than that to properly operate! Do you fancy an alternative or more accurate name for your type of ship?"

choice.text: Just say spaceship instead of complicating everything.

event.text: "...Heh. Sure, you can't go wrong, I'll give you that - but it gets old and tiring pretty fast. I'll... go find someone else and gather their idea on the matter."
It's rude, but unless it's an emergency, you can't afford to waste time right now.

"That's.. hardly more fitting. Bah, what's even the point nowadays? I suppose this shows that as a civilization we've moved on and adapted terms as we see fit, as warfare itself took a new form and adapted in return. By obsessing on the past I came to forget our present rules... Here, take this for trying."

event.name: FEDERATION_SHIPCLASS_ARGUE
event.text: "W-what? That's hardly a fitting term to use for your ship either! Is there no one else these days that bothers studying our past, wanting to correct that clear matter of misconception?"

choice.text: There's no need to be petty over that.

event.text: "PETTY?! I did not become a history aficionado just so I could be made fun of by a washed-up Renegade like you! How dare you mock me like that? I'll put you in your place!"

choice.text: Leave, before this guy comes up with an irrational excuse to open fire on you.

event.name: FEDERATION_ENCOUNTER_ELITE_STEALTH
event.text: The Federation ship patrolling this beacon is no ordinary vessel. Its distinct shape marks it as part of the Federation's latest stealth fleet, created to help keep up with the never ending arms race with the Rebellion. Fortunately, they don't seem to object to your presence, but they aren't particularly welcoming either.
For some reason, you decide to open fire on an especially well-armed allied ship. They hardly hesitate to return the favor. Hopefully this will be worth it.

choice.text: Given your sketchy reputation, it's probably best to avoid making unnecessary requests from your allies.

event.text: "...Yes? We are currently not under any orders to provide aid to passing vessels. We can provide you with some additional fuel, but not much else."
Unsatisfied at their pitiful offer, you've decided to do whatever it takes to get more.
"...Yes? We are currently not under any orders to provide aid to passing vessels. Though given your contributions, we could probably make an exception for you. Just don't spend too long deciding."
Their patrol route soons takes them away from your ship, leaving you mostly alone here.

event.name: DISTRESS_FEDERATION_KNIGHTS_AND_KNAVES
event.text: At this beacon, you find three Federation ships: a corvette, a fighter and a light cruiser. You can tell that there is a lot of comm chatter between them, suggesting that something serious is happening. As you arrive, the light cruiser's captain invites you into the open communication channel.

"Renegade, I'm glad you are here," says the light cruiser captain, "We've got a major situation on our hands. A Federation Captain went turncoat - or was a spy - and replaced his crew with Rebels! The trouble is, I'm not sure which it is, and we have no way of escorting both of them."
The captain of the fighter chips in. "Are we seriously leaving this up to a Renegade? How do we know they're not just interested in our scrap?"
"You would say that, Rebel!" The captain of the corvette says. "They're still Federation where it counts."
The fighter captain crosses her arms. "We're Federation through and through. I'm confident that we can prove it. Can you say the same?"
The captain of the light cruiser holds up his hand. "Settle down, and stop posturing. Renegade, do you have any ideas?"

Tully glances at the security feeds. As the three captains realize the admiral is in their midst, their reactions are revealing. The corvette's captain seems to look surprised, before putting on a poker face, while the other two look on in admiration. The light cruiser's captain holds his hands open. "Admiral! I didn't realize you were here!"
"Thank you both for your service. I need to talk to this defector." Tully's eyes meet the captain of the corvette. "So, why did you do it?"
"I..." The captain begins to crack. "While I was... in the academy, the Rebels took my planet. And, they gave me a choice."
"I understand. Still, you made an oath. We have three ships, and you have one. Do right by your men and surrender. They will be taken as POWs and treated fairly."
The captain nods, and surrenders.

"Oho, a mystery. I believe I'm in my element here." Haynes gestures with his pipe as he studies the feed of each ship. "Hmm, intriguing. I can't help but notice that on the fighter, there is a Federation-issue gun lying in the corner of the cockpit. Quite curious, considering you might expect a discarded weapon if there was a scuffle."
The captain of the fighter looks panicked. "I can explain!"
Haynes shakes his head. "In addition, your pilot is wearing his uniform incorrectly. Can you explain that?"
"I-I must have told him to correct it a thousand times! But I swear, he's as loyal to the Federation as he can be."
"You're right- because you're NOT the impostor."

The fighter captain's face turns from panic to confusion, then relief. "W-what do you mean?"
"Your ship bears dirt, dust, clutter and residence. The other ship is suspiciously clean, spotless and with no character. I suspect we could uncover more."
The corvette captain has a poker face. "We have nothing to hide. We clean our ship properly."
"Then, since you have nothing to hide, I'd be glad to see a video of the last time you cleaned. Surely it was within the last 24 hours? And, I'm sure there's no blood residuals either, hm?"
After a staredown, with three other ships aiming their weapons at them, the corvette finally stands down.

choice.text: (Jerry) Politely ask the impostor's crew to surrender.

event.text:
"Hey guys, it's me, Jerry." Jerry waves. The corvette's pilot looks surprised and waves at him.
"Guys! Get in here, it's Jerry!" The other Rebels start to filter into the room.
The captain looks alarmed. "What are you doing?"
"Dude, we can't lie to Jerry, man, come on."
Jerry smiles. "Would you guys mind giving the Federation their ship back?"
The captain seems unhappy at the situation, but his crew don't seem to want to harm Jerry.

choice.text: (Soldier Crew) Demand that both ships transmit data only Federation enlisted personnel would know.

event.text: Your soldier barks out a command to have every soldier salute and announce their serial number, platoon, graduating class, and drill sergeant. The fighter's crew immediately transmit a video of each crewmen saluting and proudly providing what they're ordered to. Some of them even throw an anecdote of their training along with it. The Soldier nods, satisfied with their answers. The other ship hasn't contacted you at all.

choice.text: Demand that the other ship surrender and prepare to be boarded.
Your hacking suite isn't sophisticated enough to detect forgeries.
(Adv. Hacking) Demand that the ships allow you to hack their ships.

event.text: You inform the ships that your hacking system is sophisticated enough that it can detect any forgeries that might have been set in place within the security records. The captain of the corvette scoffs in outrage. "How dare you, Renegade! We won't let you invade our privacy!" It looks like they're about to attack!

choice.text: (Mind Control) Force the impostors to reveal themselves.

event.text: Your mind control system hums to life. The fighter captain maintains her innocence - but the corvette captain clumsily blurts out his intentions. The Rebel crew behind him scramble into formation.

choice.text: (Adv. Mind Control) Force the impostors to surrender.

event.text: Your mind control system hums to life. The fighter captain maintains her innocence - but the corvette captain surrenders the moment your mind control seizes his will.

choice.text: Grill both ships until you can catch one in a lie.

event.text: You put both ships under an immense amount of pressure. As you interrogate them, you begin to put the pieces together. You're able to eventually break through the facade of the turncoat. It takes a considerable amount of time, but you're able to resolve the situation bloodlessly.

choice.text: Attack the one who's under least suspicion - this must be a trick!

event.text: You feel very clever as you turn your weapons on the light cruiser that told you about the dilemma. "What are you doing? Are you mad?"
You're not interested in what's happening here. They can work it out for themselves.

event.name: KNIGHTS_AND_KNAVES_SURRENDER
event.text: The crew of the compromised Federation ship surrender and allow the other ships to take their crew prisoner. The captain of the light cruiser invites you into another call.

event.name: KNIGHTS_AND_KNAVES_AFTERMATH
event.text: The captains of the fighter and light cruiser applaud your effort. "Splendid work. With the Rebel prisoners, the defector and our ship intact, you've resolved this conflict in a perfectly ideal way. We wish you good luck on your mission."
You point at one of the ships at random and accuse them of being the Rebel. No time to think, now is time for action!
You point at one of the ships at random and accuse them of being the Rebel. No time to think, now is time for action!

event.name: DISTRESS_FEDERATION_TEAMUP
event.text: You detect three ships in the system as you arrive at the beacon. A Duskbringer and a Rebel are trying to outflank a Federation guard as it transmits its distress call. The uneasy alliance of your enemies has broken through the Federation's defenses!
You power up your weapons and engage the Duskbringer vessel. As soon as you do, the Federation ship turns to fight the Rebel.
You power up your weapons and engage the Rebel vessel. As soon as you do, the Federation ship turns to fight the Duskbringer.

choice.text: (Devorak) Convince the Duskbringer to turn on the Rebel.

event.text: Devorak hails the Duskbringer ship. "Those treacherous Rebels are not to be trusted. Turn on them and we'll send you back to base." The Duskbringers hardly blink as they turn on their allies. The Rebel ship is promptly surrounded and eradicated by the force of three ships. Your crew begins to harvest the remains.

The Duskbringers grimace, but agree to be escorted out of Federation space. It's clear they're uneasy with any sort of compliance to the Federation, but they don't seem broken up about the deaths of the Rebels. The Federation captain is impressed. "Renegades make some strange bedfellows, don't they?"
The Federation ship can likely find help if they continue to evade. Your mission is too important to be distracted by a skirmish like this.

event.name: FEDERATION_TEAMUP_FOLLOWUP
event.text: The Federation Captain salutes you. "Thanks for stopping to help, Renegade. When the Rebels and Duskbringers started playing nice, I was hoping their alliance would fall apart. Guess it was just wishful thinking. Good luck on your mission, captain."

event.name: DISTRESS_FEDERATION_COLONY_HOSTAGE
event.text: Arriving at this beacon, there is a Federation ship and a strange, heavily armored transport ship with some old-fashioned technology. The Federation ship hails you. "This is Commodore Freamon. We have a major crisis on our hands here. That pirate transport has important hostages on board; we can't fire upon it, and you shouldn't either." The Federation officer pauses, and then continues. "They're also threatening to start attacking the colony from orbit if their demands aren't met."

Commodore Freamon sighs. "One of their demands is a powerful ship, and they have the means to take one. If you even try to get close enough to fight, they'll send boarding pods and try to take over your ship. But if you can handle a lot of attackers, we might be able to stage a counter-strike and save the hostages. Are you up for this?"

choice.text: Agree to take on the pirates.

event.text: "Best of luck, Renegade. You know what to do." The boarding pods hurtle towards your ship at a blisteringly fast pace. You're going to have to get ready for a fight!

choice.text: (Strong Defense Drone) Attempt to shoot down the pods with your Defense Drone.

event.text: Your Defense Drone fires at the incoming pods. The pods are tough, but your drone is powerful enough to destroy one of the pods before the arrival. The other one still manages to break through!

choice.text: (Weak Defense Drone) Attempt to shoot down the pods with your Defense Drone.

event.text: The pods impact your Energy Shield. Unfortunately, it was unable to stop them from tunneling in. You'll have to fight them!
The first two pods break through your hull. It's a fight!

choice.text: Tell Freamon your crew isn't ready for this.

event.text: "If you can't do it, we'll find another way. Good luck on your mission."

event.name: FEDERATION_BOARDINGPODS_WAVE2
event.text: Three more boarding pods come hurtling towards the hull. The pirates are serious about taking your ship.

choice.text: (Strong Defense Drone) Attempt to shoot down the pods with your Defense Drone.

event.text: Your Defense Drone fires at the incoming pods. The pods are tough, but your drone is powerful enough to destroy one of the pods before it gets to you. The other two still manage to break through!

choice.text: (Strong Defense Drone) Attempt to shoot down the pods with your Defense Drone.

event.text: Your Defense Drone fires at the incoming pods. The pods are tough, but your drone is powerful enough to destroy one of the pods before it gets to you. The other two still manage to break through!

choice.text: (Weak Defense Drone) Attempt to shoot down the pods with your Defense Drone.

event.text: You finally decide to deploy your drone...

choice.text: (Weak Defense Drone) Attempt to shoot down the pods with your Defense Drone.

event.text: All three pods break into your ship. More are surely on their way!
Your Defense Drone lands a glancing blow, but it's no use - the pod is too strong. You'll have to fight all of the crew that are boarding!
Your Defense Drone's first shot staggers one of the pods, and its second shot manages to knock it away, sending the boarding pod off course. You'll still have to deal with the other pod!
Your Defense Drone lands a glancing blow, but it's no use - the pod is too strong. You'll have to fight all of the crew that are boarding!
Your Defense Drone's first shot staggers one of the pods, and its second shot manages to knock it away, sending the boarding pod off course. You'll still have to deal with the other pods!
Your Defense Drone lands a glancing blow, but it's no use - the pod is too strong. You'll have to fight all of the crew that are boarding!
Your Defense Drone's first shot staggers one of the pods, and its second shot manages to knock it away, sending the boarding pod off course. You'll still have to deal with the other pods!

event.name: FEDERATION_BOARDINGPODS_WAVE3
event.text: They're committing fully to taking your ship. Four more pods are approaching!

choice.text: (Strong Defense Drone) Attempt to shoot down the pods with your Defense Drone.

event.text: Your Defense Drone fires at the incoming pods. The pods are tough, but your Defense Drone is powerful enough to destroy one of the pods before it gets to you. The other three still manage to break through. This is it!

choice.text: (Strong Defense Drone) Attempt to shoot down the pods with your Defense Drone.

event.text: Your Defense Drone fires at the incoming pods. The pods are tough, but your Defense Drone is powerful enough to destroy one of the pods before it gets to you. The other three still manage to break through. This is it!

choice.text: (Weak Defense Drone) Attempt to shoot down the pods with your Defense Drone.

event.text: You finally decide to deploy your drone...

choice.text: (Weak Defense Drone) Attempt to shoot down the pods with your Defense Drone.

event.text: All four pods break into your ship. This is it!

event.name: FEDERATION_BOARDINGPODS_WIN
event.text: "This is Freamon. We've successfully secured the hostages. I want to extend my utmost appreciation for what you've done here today. We're going to get them all to safety. The pirates had some military equipment on their ship - if you want it, it's yours." As the Commodore has his crew bring you the pirate's belongings, one of them passes on a thank-you note from a child that had been taken.

event.name: DISTRESS_FEDERATION_EMBASSY
event.text: A repeating distress signal guides you towards the local Ministry Embassy. It's alarming to find a distress signal here - made even more alarming by the Duskbringer ship posted outside the station.

You stealthily dock in one of the two hangars and make your way to the center lobby, stepping over the bodies of several deceased guards on the way. When you arrive, you find that countless civilians and guards, primarily Ministry but also numerous other species, have been tied up and gagged. Several guards stand on the sides, guns drawn, but are incapable of action without risking the civilians. A team of fully-suited up Duskbringers are holding guns to the heads of several officials, while their leader marches back and forth. "The time of complacency in our species is over! The Zoltan race did not rise from the ashes of a torched civilization to sit voicelessly on a council and die in wars caused by Human greed! A united Federation is a myth! It is time we rise up and claim our rightful place among the stars!" The Zoltan speaks stiffly, as if reciting a speech he heard spoken elsewhere.

choice.text: Reveal yourself and attempt to debate with the Duskbringer.

event.text: This is far too risky to be worth getting involved in.

event.name: FED_EMBASSY_MESSY
event.text: The embassy staff are less than pleased with your intervention. "Why does the Federation insist on hiring Renegades when they are as reckless with the lives of others as you?! None of these people had to die, but now their blood is on your hands."
While you can tell the Zoltans don't accept your apology, they at least stop their ranting and turn to handling the situation, allowing you to slip away without further consequences.

choice.text: You didn't have the situation under control at all!

event.text: Your insensitive response only angers the Zoltan further. "Well that wasn't your call to make. Now we have a diplomatic nightmare on our hands. Do you really think the project that not only hired you but allows people of your type to lawfully exist in this galaxy will continue to receive support when you act like this?" You figure it's best to leave before things get even uglier.

"You really think 30 scrap is going to make up for this? At least a dozen people are dead because of your reckless behavior." The Zoltan puts his hands over his head and paces back and forth. "This wouldn't even cover the property damage, let alone reimbursements to the families of the deceased. Just... go. You aren't wanted here."

You draw your blaster and shoot the Duskbringer in the chest. Completely unprepared for a silent ambush, he dies before he can even activate his explosive vest. The guards on the side join in the fight, and you manage to clear out the Duskbringers surprisingly quickly. With the threat handled, the embassy staff pay you handsomely for your help.

event.name: FED_EMBASSY_BAD
event.text: Unfortunately, risky moves go haywire quickly. The Duskbringers react quickly, triggering their explosive vests and taking out several hostages. While the guards join the fray, you're forced to retreat back to the ship and fight off the now hostile vessel outside.

event.name: FED_EMBASSY_GOOD
event.text: The head of the embassy even comes to shake your hand for your help. "It's a shame any bloodshed had to come from today at all - you did marvelously, disarming your opponents with words rather than guns. It was unlikely you could have convinced them to abandon their ways, but it seems much of our kind has forsworn old principles. Either way, here is your reward."

event.name: FED_EMBASSY_DEVORAK
event.text:
Devorak steps out into the open, turning all heads. "We have never been voiceless, soldier. For the Ministry to sit upon a council means to take great caution. More caution than the younger races would ever take."
"General? Why are you here? On a Renegade ship, no less?"
"Stand down, soldier. That's an order. You've made your point. Release the hostages and go."
"But we... this wasn't..." The Duskbringer visibly slackens his stance. "Yes, General. ...Even if none of you died, you will remember this."

"Unbelievable, you resolved this peacefully?" The Zoltans are in awe. "Here is your reward. And, after this business with the Rebels, we may be able to offer you a position here."
"I... what? You do...?" Devorak seems totally caught off guard. "You do... know who I am, don't you...?"

The sudden reveal of your presence puts the Duskbringers offguard - but only momentarily. Before they can harm the hostages however, you put your hands in the air to show you don't intend to attack, at least not yet. The Duskbringer leader laughs and spreads his arms wide. "Well would you look at this! A Renegade clown has decided to come and entertain us today! Tell me, gunslinging brute, what words of wisdom do you wish to share with us?"

choice.text: Your ideologies are evil and go against everything a once better galaxy worked towards!

event.text: "To claim our ideologies are evil merely proves you fail to understand the goal of the Duskbringer movement! A simple minded Renegade cannot comprehend such a grandiose picture. We are those who work towards a better galaxy. If not us, then who else is?" The Zoltan smiles, despite the fact he never bothered to explain what grand picture he claims to represent. The message however is clear - he isn't going to relent.

choice.text: If you claim to be Zoltan supremacists, then why are you endangering the lives of so many of your kind?

event.text: There's a brief pause while the Duskbringer ponders this, but he seems to think he's come up with a clever response. "The nature of our movement is that we stand to make room for the superior lifeforms in this galaxy - to give them their rightful place. It is a fact that more often than not, the Zoltans are who possess these superior characteristics, but that is not to say ALL Zoltans do. Those we have found in this unholy temple of false peace have betrayed their species to work hand in hand with lesser beings, thus becoming lesser themselves." The Duskbringer smiles smugly, having dismantled your argument. It crosses your mind you don't actually need to win this intellectual war - you just need to distract him long enough that he drops his guard.

choice.text: But who can truly decide which beings are and are not superior? What makes you the judge?

event.text: "Hmph. We are the judges because we are the only ones willing to take action. If the galaxy could have made this shift sooner, then there would be no need for the Duskbringers at all. The galaxy should have already accepted the Zoltans as the superior race - we have the better tech, the better culture, and the better minds. Sure, there are species who are stronger, or better adapted to certain environments - but there is a place for them in our new galaxy. It just won't be at the top. But only the Duskbringers can see this."

choice.text: So you aren't judges at all - just radicals who've jumped the gun.

event.text: "WE ARE NOT RADICALS!" The Duskbringer pushes his fellow men aside and storms towards you. "HOW DARE YOU INSULT OUR MOVEMENT! Radicals are people who cannot support their ideology with facts, and so they resort to extreme measures! Nothing about the Duskbringers is extreme or unsupported. We are millions strong and growing, and our methods harm no one but those directly opposed to us. You are nothing but Renegade filth, who are you to say such things? You don't know politics, you don't know-" The Zoltan is cut off by abrupt gun-fire, as the guards open fire while the Duskbringers are distracted. The Duskbringers are wiped out before they can go for the hostages, and the embassy staff seem to recognize your help and offer a reward.

choice.text: Your tech is recycled from ruins, your minds are certainly not superior, and there is no metric for a better culture.

event.text: "All of our tech is lifted from the shoulders of our ancestors - our entire multiverse is built on the ruins of some ancient empire. What matters is we Zoltan were the ones able take advantage of it. Who else do you see with hard-light shielding, or mind uploading? And our minds are most surely superior, in that they are well rounded. A Shell may have a greater capacity for scientific understanding, but they fail to grasp diplomacy or philosophical matters. And as for culture - I simply think you lack any culture at all." The Zoltan chuckles at his own joke. It seems you've failed to put him off-guard, and unfortunately you're out of responses.

choice.text: That's just stupid! Clearly you're inferior for thinking such things.

event.text: "And so the battle of wits is short-lived! It's a shame, but I will take your need to resort to petty insults as an admission to your own defeat."

choice.text: Pick your nose and pretend you don't get it.

event.text: You stand there silently, making no movements at all except to pick at your nose and scratch your rear. The Duskbringer seems entirely confused by this. "Uhm... are you listening to me? Did your brain turn off or something?" You continue to say nothing, staring blankly forward. More of the Duskbringer group start murmuring with each other, all together utterly baffled by what they're witnessing. This gives the guards just enough time to rush in and take control of the situation. The Duskbringers are wiped out before they can go for the hostages, and the embassy staff seem to recognize your help and offer a reward.

The staff of the Embassy try to congratulate you on stopping the Duskbringers, but you ignore them and continue to gaze off into the distance. You do it for so long you forget why you were even there, and eventually your crew have to drag you back to the ship. The Zoltans are confused but deliver you a reward anyways.

choice.text: If you let these citizens go, we'll give you all a free cookie.

event.text: "While it is tempting... I'm going to have to turn down your offer." The Zoltan snickers. "A cookie, really? THAT's the best you can offer? Wow. That's kind of sad."

choice.text: I forgot what I was going to say.

event.text: The Duskbringer blinks, unsure of how exactly he wants to insult you. Instead, he just laughs. "You are truly the most pathetic thing I have ever seen. Renegades must have the collective IQ equal to the number of Mantis who can spell the word 'idiot'."

event.name: FEDERATION_SHIP_STOLEN
event.text: A charred and smoking hangar resides at this beacon, barely functional. "We've been waiting for help to come by... we have truly awful news! A Federation ship has been taken by the Coalition! Please, you have to do something! We have no idea what they're going to do with it, but whatever they are planning cannot happen!"
"We can still track their ship... fortunately we were not all killed in their escape. Please hurry!"
"Are you insane? The importance of this mission is... no, I'm sorry. I know your mission is important too. We will find somebody else."

event.name: FEDERATION_SHIP_STOLEN_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The Coalition has seized a Federation ship, and it is currently at this beacon.

event.text: The occupied Federation ship is approaching a Union station. But as soon as you move within sensor range, it disengages to face your ship instead!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_FED_SALVAGE
event.text: You find the wreck of a Federation ship nearby. Before you can even begin to consider salvaging it, another Federation ship jumps in. They demand an explanation for what happened.

choice.text: Tell them you didn't destroy this ship.

event.text: Your good reputation precedes you. Once they realize who you are, they apologize for the mix-up and offer to help you harvest the ship faster. Though not much remains, you find some usable equipment, and a small helping of scrap for your troubles.

choice.text: Tell them you didn't destroy this ship.
Tell them you didn't destroy this ship.

event.text: Whilst you try to convince them that they're mistaken, they don't seem inclined to believe you. "We've heard about all your misdeeds here! You really expect us to buy that you're not responsible?"

choice.text: Fight your way out of this.

event.text: You mute comms and prepare to fight them. Judging by how quickly they move to defend themselves, it seems this was what they expected you to do.

After a few moments of skepticism, the Federation relents and lets you harvest the ship in peace. Though not much remains, you find some usable equipment, and a small helping of scrap for your troubles.

"Hmph. You're still taking the remains, you Renegade vulture." They back off, letting you harvest the ship. Though not much remains, you find some usable equipment, and a small helping of scrap for your troubles.
"Sorry about that. Some Renegades aren't so well behaved. I'll help you out." Though not much remains, you find some usable equipment, and a small helping of scrap for your troubles.

"Well, if you were responsible for this, I'm sure we'd already be fighting. Let me give you a hand." Though not much remains, you find some usable equipment, and a small helping of scrap for your troubles.
"A likely story! Word has it that some Renegades will harvest any ship unlucky enough to cross paths with them. You'll pay for this!"

choice.text: Point out that due to game mechanics, you are unable to fight two ships at a single beacon.

event.text: The Federation ship immediately stops its aggression and apologizes. "I'm such an idiot. Why don't you just take the harvest, a little extra scrap and we both forget this ever happened?"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_FED_REBELTAKEOVER
event.text: You receive an urgent hail from the nearby Federation ship. "You have to help, the Rebels, they've taken over the ship!" The call suddenly goes to static and the ship turns hostile!

event.name: REBELTAKEOVER_SURRENDER
event.text: The new Rebel "captain" of the ship hails you. "Alright, you've caused enough damage. Let us go, and we'll spare the last survivor of the original crew."

choice.text: The death of one more Fed is worth the death of even more Rebels.

event.name: REBELTAKEOVER_DESTROY
event.text: You've destroyed the Federation ship, and with it the Rebel and Federation crew. You salvage what's left of the wreck.

event.name: REBELTAKEOVER_DEADCREW
event.text: You've killed off all of the Rebel crew. As you salvage the ship, you notice the body of one of the old Federation crew. You find they're still alive, and help them to their feet. After some washing and first-aid they're good as new and ready to serve on your ship.

event.name: STEALTH_UNLOCK_1
event.text: You arrive near a small fleet of Federation and Engi ships. A simple decryption and translation of their comm frequency tells you that they are having a frantic discussion about something obviously troubling them.

choice.text: Message them and ask if you can help.

event.text: Slightly shocked at your question, their leader quickly responds, "Declined offer with apologetic gratitude. Topic of discussion private matter, no concern of Multiverse vigilantes."
You can't help but wonder what they were discussing as you prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Harmony Crew) Have your Engi crewmember contact them.

event.text: Your crewmember syncs with the comm unit to communicate with them directly. You offer your help and a summary of the ship's mission. They respond, "Our goals have analogous elements. However, not all available for disclosure, discretion necessary."

"Secret prototype stolen by Mantis, initiating high profile trade with Rebels. Cargo ship location: unknown. Mantis Suzerain dispatched to Rebel base to deliver information on prototype whereabouts. Transmitting location of known data transfer location."

"However, Mantis ship potentially stopped by second base on travel. Would calculate probability of transfer occuring here but data insufficient. Cannot risk obvious Rebel-Engi conflict. Also, need time to acquire military ships. Assist in finding technology?"

escape.text: As soon as they see you, they power up their engines to jump away. Stop them!

gotaway.text: With the ship gone you search through the abandoned base for any signs of their destination but find none.

destroyed.text: You take what you can from the debris.

deadCrew.text: A quick search of their communication logs shows that the tech you were searching for never passed through this base... It must have been a decoy! You strip what you can and prepare to jump.

event.name: STEALTH_UNLOCK_2FAKE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Suspected location of the stolen Engi prototype.

event.text: You arrive at one of the Rebel bases that the Engi told you about. It appears abandoned except for one well armed Elite ship. Perhaps you could extract information from them.

event.name: STEALTH_UNLOCK_2FAKE_SURRENDER
event.text: "Stop! Stop! Why is the Federation so damn ravenous! Don't you have better things to do than hunting down random Rebel ships when you have other battles to fight?"

choice.text: Demand information on the stolen technology.

event.text: "Ah, so that's what you're after. Too bad, you followed the wrong ship. The envoy that passed through here was a fake, to trick fools like you. Now let us go!"
"Hah! And don't think the fleet won't hear about this!" The Rebels jump away.
"No, wait!" You cut the transmission and continue the assault.

escape.text: As soon as they see you they power up their engines to jump away. Stop them!

gotaway.text: With the ship gone, you search through the abandoned base for any signs of their destination but find none.

destroyed.text: You take what you can from the debris.

deadCrew.text: Once their crew is dead you scan the ship for the stolen blueprints but find none. Instead, you find recordings of a conversation with an MFK Ace... the Mantis must have already transfered off the data. You strip the ship and prepare to pursue.

event.name: STEALTH_UNLOCK_2REAL

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Suspected location of the stolen Engi prototype.

event.text: You arrive at one of the Rebel bases that the Engi told you about. It appears mostly abandoned, save for a Suzerain ship. This must be the one the Engi were searching for!

event.name: STEALTH_UNLOCK_2REAL_SURRENDER
event.text: "Eek! Me not want to die here! Many apologizing Federation, now stop firing!"

choice.text: Demand information on the stolen technology.

event.text: "Oh yes yes, that why you here. Yes, MFK ship arrive, paying much well for data! We give them location of envoy, and taking pay! You understanding it's just job, yes? You surely run mercenary job time to time!"
You prepare an FTL message containing the coordinates to send to the Engi and get ready to jump.

deadCrew.text: You strip what you can and contact the Engi ships.

event.name: STEALTH_UNLOCK_3

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Confirmed location of the stolen Engi prototype.

event.text: You have finally caught up with the MFK Ace ship. A hangar-sized Mantis cargo ship has stopped nearby, guarded by a mix of Mantis and Rebels. As you reconsider the assault, a squadron of Engi ships with pirate emblems jump in and assist you. You get involved and attack one of the nearby Rebels head-on.

event.name: STEALTH_UNLOCK_4
event.text: The Engi emerge victorious from their battles with only minor losses. They message you, "Project X-ME56 commissioned by Federation military research division. Advanced Stealth Cruiser. Project finished during rebellion. Unable to reconnect with Federation military command."
"Likely ploy by Rebels to avoid breaking non-aggression pact with Engi. 97.56 percent likely. Your mission to assist last Federation fleet, correct? Coordinates?"

"Satisfactory. Delivery of tech will assist in Federation cause. Gratitude alone insufficient. Commencing ship repair and compensation." Their crews deliver an advanced augmentation for installation but you're more pleased to hear that the Federation will have an improved arsenal.

event.name: FED_MEMORIAL
event.text: It's clear from the minute you jump in that this is an important location. A massive, stunning memorial has been built here, so large it can easily be seen from space.

The memorial appears to have been constructed in honor of Universe 0, and more specifically the battle of Node 17. You exit your ship to observe a giant wall of names, a list of every Federation officer who gave their lives fighting in Node 17, whether they died from a kamikaze Auto, a Rebel ship, or a fatal injury sustained during battle. It moves you greatly, having come from Universe 0.

A blazing siren screams throughout the city, and a monotone voice speaks. "This is not a drill. Repeat, this is not a drill. A Rebel squadron has been seen approaching the city. All civilians are to clear out of any unprotected areas and seek out shelter immediately. Any Federation personnel within the city limits are to report to command immediately to defend against the approaching threat."

choice.text: You won't stand for this. Do all you can to help!

event.text: At the lead of the Rebel squadron is an unusual Rebel ship, one unlike anything you've seen before. It wields a powerful artillery weapon. If you can take it down, maybe it'll discourage the rest of the fleet.
You aren't interested in getting caught up in this fight. You're certain the Federation ships here will be able to fend off the Rebels.

event.name: FED_MEMORIAL_INTERMEDIATE
event.text: Around you, you can see Rebel ships beginning to flee as the Federation forces push them back. Their last hope, the Gunboat and your target, has already taken critical damage. You have to keep fighting!

event.name: FED_MEMORIAL_DESTROY
event.text: The Gunboat has received critical damage, too much for it to sustain. Its artillery system crackles and the engines explode. The ship goes spiraling down into the nearby lake. It explodes one last time once it collides with the water, showering the coast. The sight of their leading ship dispatched so efficiently is enough to chase away the rest of the Rebels. Every last hostile ship jumps away, leaving the Federation the undisputed victor.

event.name: FED_MEMORIAL_DEAD_CREW
event.text: The lifeless Gunboat begins to plummet towards the ground. It smashes into the coast, erupting into a glorious display of flames, though luckily it causes no damage to any of the infrastructure of the city. The sight of their leading ship dispatched so efficiently is enough to chase away the rest of the Rebels. Every last hostile ship jumps away, leaving the Federation the undisputed victor.

event.name: FED_MEMORIAL_WIN
event.text: You are hailed by a Federation officer in the city, who requests that you land. As you exit your vessel, all around civilians cheer for you. You recognize Vice Admiral Adara, the voice who spoke to you. "You have done us a great service today. I do not know how to thank you for protecting this city. I have heard stories, well, myths and legends really, of the Multiverse Renegades, and I've always been skeptical. Now, all of my doubts have been assuaged."

Adara puts a shiny medal around your neck, an honor that you will carry on for life, assuming you succeed in your mission. Every support ship in the district is dispatched to aid you in every way they can, and you're even given a fresh new Federation cruiser from one of their hangars. You don't really have a use for this ship, so you forward its blueprints to the hangar.

As you are leaving, Adara pulls you aside to tell you one last thing. "This package, it is extremely important that it arrives to Tully in time. I don't have time to bring it to him myself, but I know I can trust you with it. Godspeed, captain."
